section.title: countries creating new Country
section.para: To create a new Country definition, select the NEW button. The following screen will appear:
When creating a new Country definition, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter a short abbreviation for the Country.

tip.para: Defining Currency information for Countries helps standardize the process of defining Currencies.

listitem.para: Enter a name to identify the Country's Currency.

Enter a symbol to identify the Country's Currency. Use special keyboard characters to enter special Currency symbols. For example, under Windows, you can create the symbol for Japanese Yen "" by using the following keys: ALT + 0165.
Enter a short abbreviation for the Country's Currency.
Enter a number to uniquely identify the Currency. For example, in the standard Currencies defined in the default Countries table, the Currency Number used is the ISO-assigned Currency Number.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without adding a new Country definition to the master list of Countries.
Creates the Country definition and adds it to the master list of Countries.
